body_html: Most layers don't do more than 3 operations, so it should be pretty straightforward to figure out what operations correspond to different layers. I don't think adding annotations in Python by default is a good idea, because that would increase the overhead and skew the results. CProfile won't be useful if you want to get this kind of information, but autograd profiler should be just fine (that's what we've been using quite successfully so far).

body: Most layers don't do more than 3 operations, so it should be pretty straightforward to figure out what operations correspond to different layers. I don't think adding annotations in Python by default is a good idea, because that would increase the overhead and skew the results. CProfile won't be useful if you want to get this kind of information, but autograd profiler should be just fine (that's what we've been using quite successfully so far).
